subject: Re: [junit] JUNIT test methods
msgSnippet: ... Show us /exactly/ what the problem is. [I would have thought that you could just start using the JUnit assert methods.] -- Hewlett-Packard Limited
messageBody:
On Thursday 21 June 2007 18:39, sireesha wrote:
> Hi,
> We have a custom code for unit testing. the architecture is similar to
> JUNIT. now wea re planning to migrate to JUNIT to explore the
> reporting features etc. the issue is with the testXXXX() methods. I
> would like to use assertion whereever we are doing a check. Our testXXX
> () methods donot return void. Most of them return boolean. How cna i
> still use the assertions without rewamping the code.
> thanks

Show us /exactly/ what the problem is.

[I would have thought that you could just start using the JUnit
assert methods.]

--
